items.title: House committee releases image of entire Epstein birthday album, including letter signed by Trump – as it happened
items.standfirst: This blog is now closed. You can read more on the album and letter here: House Democrats share screenshot of apparent Trump birthday note to EpsteinIntent on vindication after spending four months in prison last year, Peter Navarro asked a federal appeals court on Sunday night to force Donald Trump’s justice department to explain why it would not defend his 2022 conviction for defying a January 6 committee subpoena.The request to the US court of appeals for the DC circuit is fraught for the department as it would have to confront the appearance that it quietly dropped the case in order to shield Navarro after he was tapped as a senior adviser to the president. Continue reading...

items.title: House committee releases image of apparent Trump birthday note and entire Epstein album
items.standfirst: Image mirrors report of letter, turned over by estate lawyers after subpoena and part of ‘infamous “Birthday Book”’US politics live – latest updatesHouse Democrats on Monday released an image of a sexually suggestive letter and drawing that appears to bear the signature of Donald Trump, the very same note the president had denied writing after reports of its existence were published earlier this year in the Wall Street Journal.The letter, which was turned over by lawyers for disgraced financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein’s estate in response to a subpoena from the House oversight committee, was included in a set of notes sent to the convicted sex offender for his 50th birthday. Continue reading...
items.content: Image mirrors report of letter, turned over by estate lawyers after subpoena and part of ‘infamous “Birthday Book”’US politics live – latest updatesHouse Democrats on Monday released an image of a sexually suggestive letter and drawing that appears to bear the signature of Donald Trump, the very same note the president had denied writing after reports of its existence were published earlier this year in the Wall Street Journal.The letter, which was turned over by lawyers for disgraced financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein’s estate in response to a subpoena from the House oversight committee, was included in a set of notes sent to the convicted sex offender for his 50th birthday. items.title: House Democrats release birthday note to Epstein allegedly from Trump
items.standfirst: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee have released what they claim is a copy of a birthday note that President Trump sent to Jeffrey Epstein in 2003. The president has denied penning the message. Scott MacFarlane has details.
items.content: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee have released what they claim is a copy of a birthday note that President Trump sent to Jeffrey Epstein in 2003. The president has denied penning the message. Scott MacFarlane has details.

items.title: News Wrap: Democrats release birthday message Trump allegedly sent to Jeffrey Epstein
items.standfirst: In our news wrap Monday, House Democrats released a letter that Donald Trump allegedly sent to Jeffrey Epstein for a 2003 birthday book, the Trump administration is asking the Supreme Court to keep nearly five billion dollars in foreign aid frozen and a federal appeals court upheld a ruling that…
items.content: In our news wrap Monday, House Democrats released a letter that Donald Trump allegedly sent to Jeffrey Epstein for a 2003 birthday book, the Trump administration is asking the Supreme Court to keep nearly five billion dollars in foreign aid frozen and a federal appeals court upheld a ruling that…

items.title: Details on alleged Trump message for Epstein, Trump's denial
items.standfirst: A birthday message allegedly written by President Trump to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein was released by Democrats on the House Oversight Committee on Monday. Mr. Trump has denied writing the message. CBS News legal reporter Katrina Kaufman has more.
items.content: A birthday message allegedly written by President Trump to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein was released by Democrats on the House Oversight Committee on Monday. Mr. Trump has denied writing the message. CBS News legal reporter Katrina Kaufman has more.

items.title: House releases Trump's alleged birthday message to Jeffrey Epstein
items.standfirst: The Republican-led House Oversight Committee received materials Monday from convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's estate, including a birthday book containing an explicit message allegedly from President Trump to Epstein. Mr. Trump has denied writing the message. Barry Levine, author of the book "The Spider: Inside the Criminal Web of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell," joined CBS News to discuss.
items.content: The Republican-led House Oversight Committee received materials Monday from convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's estate, including a birthday book containing an explicit message allegedly from President Trump to Epstein. Mr. Trump has denied writing the message. Barry Levine, author of the book "The Spider: Inside the Criminal Web of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell," joined CBS News to discuss.

items.title: Estate of Jeffrey Epstein gives Congress 'birthday book' allegedly signed by Trump
items.standfirst: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee said the book included a tawdry drawing and note that appeared to include President Trump's signature. Trump had previously denied its existence.
items.content: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee said the book included a tawdry drawing and note that appeared to include President Trump's signature. Trump had previously denied its existence. (Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)

items.title: Trump’s alleged, suggestive birthday note to Epstein released by Democrats
items.standfirst: After the letter was first reported by the WSJ, Trump denied he had written such a note and later sued for $10bn.
items.content: After the letter was first reported by the WSJ, Trump denied he had written such a note and later sued for $10bn.

ai_summary: House Democrats released records from Jeffrey Epstein's estate, including a note.
The note, allegedly from Trump, was written in an Epstein birthday book.
The note includes an outline of a woman's body, sparking controversy.
Trump has denied writing the message or drawing the image in the note.
MAGA influencers have largely dismissed the note as a forgery.

clusters.title: France in fresh political crisis after MPs oust prime minister

items.title: France in fresh political crisis after MPs oust prime minister
items.standfirst: The French government loses a vote of confidence and PM François Bayrou will resign on Tuesday.
items.content: The French government loses a vote of confidence and PM François Bayrou will resign on Tuesday.

items.title: French government collapses as prime minister is ousted
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron must search for a fourth prime minister in 12 months after Prime Minister François Bayrou was ousted.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron must search for a fourth prime minister in 12 months after Prime Minister François Bayrou was ousted.

items.title: French government collapses as PM François Bayrou loses confidence vote
items.standfirst: President Emmanuel Macron will look for a replacement who can break the budget impasse
items.content: President Emmanuel Macron will look for a replacement who can break the budget impasse

items.title: François Bayrou ousted as French PM after losing confidence vote
items.standfirst: Government collapses after Emmanuel Macron’s ally wins support of just 194 MPs with 364 against François Bayrou has been ousted in a confidence vote after only nine months as prime minister, collapsing his minority government and plunging France into a political crisis.Bayrou, 74, will hand his resignation to Emmanuel Macron, his longterm centrist ally, on Tuesday morning. Continue reading...
items.content: Government collapses after Emmanuel Macron’s ally wins support of just 194 MPs with 364 against François Bayrou has been ousted in a confidence vote after only nine months as prime minister, collapsing his minority government and plunging France into a political crisis.Bayrou, 74, will hand his resignation to Emmanuel Macron, his longterm centrist ally, on Tuesday morning. Continue reading...

items.title: France's government collapses after the prime minister loses a confidence vote
items.standfirst: Legislators toppled France's government in a confidence vote, a new crisis for Europe's second-largest economy. Prime Minister François Bayrou was ousted overwhelmingly in a 364-194 vote against him.
items.content: Legislators toppled France's government in a confidence vote, a new crisis for Europe's second-largest economy. Prime Minister François Bayrou was ousted overwhelmingly in a 364-194 vote against him.(Image credit: Christophe Ena)

items.title: Why has the French PM had to go and what happens next?
items.standfirst: France's prime minister has lost a confidence vote, sending parliament into another period of chaos and uncertainty.
items.content: France's prime minister has lost a confidence vote, sending parliament into another period of chaos and uncertainty.

items.title: France's ruling government collapses in major blow to President Emmanuel Macron
items.standfirst: France's National Assembly is set to vote for a motion of no confidence in François Bayrou, less than a year after they did the same for Michel Barnier.
items.content: France's National Assembly is set to vote for a motion of no confidence in François Bayrou, less than a year after they did the same for Michel Barnier.

items.title: French PM loses confidence vote - as country's political crisis deepens
items.standfirst: France's prime minister has failed in a last-minute bid to save his job, with the country's National Assembly ousting him in a confidence vote.
items.content: France's prime minister has failed in a last-minute bid to save his job, with the country's National Assembly ousting him in a confidence vote.

ai_summary: French Prime Minister François Bayrou lost a confidence vote in parliament.
The vote resulted in 364 against and 194 in favor of Bayrou.
President Emmanuel Macron must find a fourth prime minister in a year.
Bayrou's government collapsed after only nine months in power.
The ousting plunges France into a new political crisis.

clusters.title: Nepal rolls back social media ban after deadly protests rock capital
clusters.neutral_headline: Nepal Lifts Social Media Ban After Deadly Protests

items.title: Nepal rolls back social media ban after deadly protests rock capital
items.standfirst: Thousands joined the ‘Gen Z’ demonstrations, which protesters said reflected their frustration with the ban and anger over alleged corrupt officialsNepal’s government has lifted its ban on 26 prominent social media apps and messaging services after at least 19 people were killed and more than 100 injured in clashes on Monday.The country’s communication and information minister announced the ban would be rolled back hours after demonstrators protesting against the block surged towards the parliament complex in the capital, Kathmandu. Continue reading...
items.content: Thousands joined the ‘Gen Z’ demonstrations, which protesters said reflected their frustration with the ban and anger over alleged corrupt officialsNepal’s government has lifted its ban on 26 prominent social media apps and messaging services after at least 19 people were killed and more than 100 injured in clashes on Monday.The country’s communication and information minister announced the ban would be rolled back hours after demonstrators protesting against the block surged towards the parliament complex in the capital, Kathmandu. Continue reading...

items.title: Protests in Nepal over social media ban turn deadly
items.standfirst: At least 19 people were killed as protests broke out over a government attempt to regulate social media that blocked some of the world’s largest platforms.
items.content: At least 19 people were killed as protests broke out over a government attempt to regulate social media that blocked some of the world’s largest platforms.

items.title: Nepal lifts social media ban after deadly protests
items.standfirst: Nepal has lifted a ban on social media platforms including Facebook and YouTube after protests that led to 19 people being killed.
items.content: Nepal has lifted a ban on social media platforms including Facebook and YouTube after protests that led to 19 people being killed.

items.title: Nepal lifts social media ban after 19 killed in protests: Report
items.standfirst: Nepal's Communications and Information Technology Minister Prithvi Subba Gurung says the ban is 'withdrawn'.
items.content: Nepal's Communications and Information Technology Minister Prithvi Subba Gurung says the ban is 'withdrawn'.

items.title: Nepal ‘Gen Z’ protest death toll climbs, parliament stormed
items.standfirst: ‘Gen Z’ demonstrators took to the streets and stormed parliament amid anger over a social media ban and corruption.
items.content: ‘Gen Z’ demonstrators took to the streets and stormed parliament amid anger over a social media ban and corruption.

items.title: At least 19 killed in ‘gen Z’ protests against Nepal’s social media ban
items.standfirst: Many demonstrators say they are also on the streets over corruption and nepotism they allege is rampant At least 19 people have been killed during protests in Nepal over a government ban on dozens of online platforms including Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and X.The government has faced mounting criticism after imposing a ban on 26 prominent social media platforms and messaging apps last week because they had missed a deadline to register under new regulations. Continue reading...
items.content: Many demonstrators say they are also on the streets over corruption and nepotism they allege is rampant At least 19 people have been killed during protests in Nepal over a government ban on dozens of online platforms including Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and X.The government has faced mounting criticism after imposing a ban on 26 prominent social media platforms and messaging apps last week because they had missed a deadline to register under new regulations. Continue reading...

items.title: At least 19 dead in Nepal after Gen Z protests at corruption and social media ban
items.standfirst: Young protesters are demanding the government lift its social media ban and tackle corruption.
items.content: Young protesters are demanding the government lift its social media ban and tackle corruption.

items.title: Nepal Scraps Social-Media Ban After Clashes Kill 19 People
items.standfirst: Nepal’s government scrapped a days-old prohibition on social-media after the ban sparked deadly clashes between police and protesters that local media reported left 19 people dead and 347 injured.
items.content: Nepal’s government scrapped a days-old prohibition on social-media after the ban sparked deadly clashes between police and protesters that local media reported left 19 people dead and 347 injured.

ai_summary: Nepal lifted its ban on 26 social media platforms after protests.
The protests resulted in at least 19 deaths and over 100 injuries.
Protesters demonstrated against the ban and alleged corruption.
The government's ban was imposed due to registration deadlines.
Demonstrators also protested against corruption and nepotism.

Fox News will remain unchanged, continuing its conservative direction as favored by patriarch Rupert Murdoch and…

items.title: Murdoch family reaches deal to resolve succession fight over media empire
items.standfirst: Family announces Rupert Murdoch’s eldest son, Lachlan Murdoch, will secure control of businessThe succession battle at Rupert Murdoch’s media empire has ended.The family announced on Monday that Lachlan Murdoch, Murdoch’s eldest son, will secure control of the Murdochs’ sprawling media empire that includes Fox News, The Wall Street Journal and The Times in the UK, with his three oldest siblings receiving an estimated $1.1bn each for their shares in the business. Continue reading...
items.content: Family announces Rupert Murdoch’s eldest son, Lachlan Murdoch, will secure control of businessThe succession battle at Rupert Murdoch’s media empire has ended.The family announced on Monday that Lachlan Murdoch, Murdoch’s eldest son, will secure control of the Murdochs’ sprawling media empire that includes Fox News, The Wall Street Journal and The Times in the UK, with his three oldest siblings receiving an estimated $1.1bn each for their shares in the business. Continue reading...

items.title: Murdochs reach deal in succession battle over media empire
items.standfirst: Lachlan Murdoch will retain control the conservative Fox and News Corp empire under the deal.
items.content: Lachlan Murdoch will retain control the conservative Fox and News Corp empire under the deal.

items.title: Murdoch seals $3.3bn succession deal to hand empire to eldest son
items.standfirst: Lachlan takes control as three siblings receive $1.1bn each to settle long-running family feud
items.content: Lachlan takes control as three siblings receive $1.1bn each to settle long-running family feud

items.title: Rupert Murdoch buys out 3 of his children to seal fate of his media empire
items.standfirst: The owner of Fox News, the Wall Street Journal and dozens of other media properties has settled a legal fight with three of his own children over who would control his companies after his death.
items.content: The owner of Fox News, the Wall Street Journal and dozens of other media properties has settled a legal fight with three of his own children over who would control his companies after his death.(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker/Getty Images)

ai_summary: The Murdoch family resolved its succession dispute with a new trust.
Lachlan Murdoch will take control of the media empire.
His siblings will receive an estimated $1.1 billion each.
The deal ensures Fox News will remain conservative.
The settlement ends a long-running family legal battle.

items.title: Reporter's Notebook: The risks of believing Putin's promises
items.standfirst: A month after President Trump's meeting with Russia's Vladimir Putin ended in promises, Ukraine faced its heaviest bombardment yet. "CBS Evening News" co-anchor explains.
items.content: A month after President Trump's meeting with Russia's Vladimir Putin ended in promises, Ukraine faced its heaviest bombardment yet. "CBS Evening News" co-anchor explains.

items.title: Six Israelis killed in terror attack at bus stop
items.standfirst: Six Israelis were killed when police said two Palestinian gunmen opened fire on people at a bus stop in Jerusalem. The gunmen were later killed. NBC News’ Richard Engel reports.
items.content: Six Israelis were killed when police said two Palestinian gunmen opened fire on people at a bus stop in Jerusalem. The gunmen were later killed. NBC News’ Richard Engel reports.

items.title: Israel vows retaliation over deadly Jerusalem shooting
items.standfirst: Israeli authorities vowed retaliation after two gunmen from the occupied West Bank killed six people at a bus stop in Jerusalem on Monday. The shooting — one of the deadliest attacks in Israel since Oct. 7, 2023 — prompted Israeli leaders to vow to step up raids in the West Bank, as Israel plans…
items.content: Israeli authorities vowed retaliation after two gunmen from the occupied West Bank killed six people at a bus stop in Jerusalem on Monday. The shooting — one of the deadliest attacks in Israel since Oct. 7, 2023 — prompted Israeli leaders to vow to step up raids in the West Bank, as Israel plans…

items.title: Palestinian gunmen kill six people at Jerusalem bus stop
items.standfirst: At least 12 others injured in attack at Ramot intersection during morning rush hourPalestinian gunmen opened fire at a crowded bus stop in the northern outskirts of Jerusalem on Monday, killing six people and injuring 12 others before being shot dead by an off-duty soldier and a civilian at the scene.The victims included a 79-year-old former cardiologist, a 43-year-old rabbi and a 25-year-old who had recently emigrated from Spain. Twenty-six others suffered injuries, including six who were left in a serious condition with gunshot wounds. Continue reading...
items.content: At least 12 others injured in attack at Ramot intersection during morning rush hourPalestinian gunmen opened fire at a crowded bus stop in the northern outskirts of Jerusalem on Monday, killing six people and injuring 12 others before being shot dead by an off-duty soldier and a civilian at the scene.The victims included a 79-year-old former cardiologist, a 43-year-old rabbi and a 25-year-old who had recently emigrated from Spain. Twenty-six others suffered injuries, including six who were left in a serious condition with gunshot wounds. Continue reading...

items.content: Israeli police say two gunmen were killed after the attack, which was one of the deadliest in the city in years.

items.content: Two gunmen opened fire at a Jerusalem bus stop Monday, killing six people and critically injuring seven others, emergency services said

items.content: Two gunmen boarded a bus on the outskirts of Jerusalem at rush hour and shot dead six people in one of the deadliest attacks the city has seen in recent times.

ai_summary: Six Israelis were killed in a shooting at a Jerusalem bus stop.
Two Palestinian gunmen opened fire, injuring at least 12 others.
The gunmen were shot dead by an off-duty soldier and a civilian.
The attack is one of the deadliest in Israel since October 7, 2023.
Israel vowed retaliation following the deadly shooting.

items.title: Microsoft Signs Nebius Cloud Deal Worth Up to $19.4 Billion
items.standfirst: Microsoft Corp. struck a multiyear deal worth nearly $20 billion to get AI cloud computing power from Nebius Group NV, the technology company spun out from Russian internet giant Yandex.
items.content: Microsoft Corp. struck a multiyear deal worth nearly $20 billion to get AI cloud computing power from Nebius Group NV, the technology company spun out from Russian internet giant Yandex.

ai_summary: Microsoft signed a deal with Nebius for AI cloud computing power.
The deal is worth up to $19.4 billion and runs through 2031.
Nebius will provide AI computing power via a New Jersey data center.
Nebius is backed by Nvidia and spun out from Yandex.
The deal will help power Microsoft's artificial intelligence ambitions.

clusters.title: Freight train slams into a bus outside Mexico City and kills at least 10 people
clusters.neutral_headline: Freight train slams into a bus outside Mexico City and kills at least 10 people

items.title: Freight train slams into a bus outside Mexico City and kills at least 10 people
items.standfirst: A freight train sheared a double-decker bus in half at a crossing northwest of Mexico City early Monday, killing at least 10 people and injuring more than 40, authorities said.
items.content: A freight train sheared a double-decker bus in half at a crossing northwest of Mexico City early Monday, killing at least 10 people and injuring more than 40, authorities said.

items.title: At least 10 dead, 41 injured, after train rams bus
items.standfirst: A freight train has collided with a double-decker bus in Mexico, shearing it in two and killing at least 10 people while injuring 41 others, authorities said.
items.content: A freight train has collided with a double-decker bus in Mexico, shearing it in two and killing at least 10 people while injuring 41 others, authorities said.

items.title: At least 10 killed when freight train hits double-decker bus in Mexico
items.standfirst: Authorities say more than 60 were injured in the crash, northwest of Mexico City, as the cause remains unclear.
items.content: Authorities say more than 60 were injured in the crash, northwest of Mexico City, as the cause remains unclear.

ai_summary: A freight train collided with a double-decker bus near Mexico City.
At least 10 people were killed in the collision.
Over 40 people were injured in the crash.
The bus was sheared in half by the train.
Authorities are investigating the cause of the crash.

items.title: Attorney says detained Korean Hyundai workers had special skills for short-term jobs

items.content: An immigration attorney says many South Korean workers detained in a U.S. immigration raid at a Hyundai plant in Georgia were brought in for highly specialized work that Americans aren't trained to perform.

items.title: South Korea says it is helping citizens return voluntarily after huge Hyundai raid
items.standfirst: The South Korean government said Monday that it was arranging for hundreds of its nationals to leave the United States voluntarily after they were detained in an immigration raid on a Hyundai facility in Georgia that has strained relations with the key U.S. ally
items.content: The South Korean government said Monday that it was arranging for hundreds of its nationals to leave the United States voluntarily after they were detained in an immigration raid on a Hyundai facility in Georgia that has strained relations with the key U.S. ally

items.title: South Korean worker tells BBC of panic during US immigration raid at Hyundai plant

items.standfirst: Over the past year, Meta has blanketed TV screens around the world with commercials touting the privacy of Whatsapp, its encrypted messenger with a monthly user base of 3 billion people. “It’s private,” one ad campaign featuring the former cast of the Modern Family TV show says. “On Whatsapp, no…
items.content: Over the past year, Meta has blanketed TV screens around the world with commercials touting the privacy of Whatsapp, its encrypted messenger with a monthly user base of 3 billion people. “It’s private,” one ad campaign featuring the former cast of the Modern Family TV show says. “On Whatsapp, no…

items.title: Former WhatsApp security boss in lawsuit likens Meta’s culture to a “cult”
items.standfirst: Meta allegedly prioritized user growth over security, lawsuit said.
items.content: Over the past year, Meta has blanketed TV screens around the world with commercials touting the privacy of Whatsapp, its encrypted messenger with a monthly user base of 3 billion people. “It’s private,” one ad campaign featuring the former cast of the Modern Family TV show says. “On Whatsapp, no one can see or hear your personal messages … not even us,” a different series of ads declares. “Serious risks to user data” On Monday, the former head of security for the Meta-owed messaging app filed a federal whistleblower lawsuit that tells a far different narrative. The suit, filed in US District Court for the District of Northern California, recites a litany of purported security and privacy flaws that Meta not only didn’t fix after becoming aware of them, but also kept secret, allegedly in violation of a $5 billion settlement then-Whatsapp parent company Facebook reached with the Federal Trade Commission. The complaint was filed by Attaullah Baig, who became head of WhatsApp security in 2021.Read full article Comments

ai_summary: A former WhatsApp security head is suing Meta, alleging a "cult-like" culture.
The lawsuit claims Meta prioritized user growth over security.
Meta has advertised WhatsApp's privacy features extensively.
The lawsuit highlights concerns about Meta's internal priorities.
The lawsuit was filed by a former employee of Meta's WhatsApp.
